intro: Centaurea djebel-amouri, commonly known as the Djebel Amouri thistle, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its blue to purple flowers are surrounded by spiny bracts, a feature common in the Centaurea genus. It is often found in mountainous regions, contributing to the local flora diversity.
